text: early on when I moved into
entrepreneurship I started off right out
of college as a management consultant
and I did nine product launches over two
years mainly in the in the telco space
and I quickly realized that although I
enjoy the the intellectual challenge of
consulting I didn't get the satisfaction
of actually building the thing that we
were advising companies about and so I
left from management consulting and went
right into startups and I've been there
ever since a key turning point in my
career was the advent of agile software
development came into being about 15
years ago although we didn't really gain
adoption until about 10 years ago an
agile development is the is a
methodology a software development
methodology that focuses on flexibility
on iteration and the discovery of true
customer needs it's been a very exciting
time to be an entrepreneur also in the
software space and in particular to be
in product management I often enjoy
questions that are about early-stage
software startups in general they could
be also about enterprise b2b business
models or two sided marketplace business
models both of which I've done or about
product management as a profession but I
also very much enjoy discussions that
are often about MVPs or minimum viable
product is one of the key concepts of
the Lean Startup concept or the Lean
Startup philosophy and yet it's often a
very difficult one for first-time
entrepreneurs to to put into practice
you
